Articles.Content: Scratch my last. It has to be the agency of the astronaut, otherwise we wouldn't have JAXA.

> 
> Problem with this crossword is that there seem to be multiple valid solutions and no real way of determining which is the "official" answer.

Take 19 across for instance. There are a lot of Russian cosmonauts with 6-letter surnames ending with V. I count at least Ivanov, Leonov, and Volkov. Any of those could be right - and that's assuming it's people not missions.

When there's more than one valid solution and no other hints provided, it doesn't exactly make for a solvable puzzle.
I've got 16 down as being **Glenn**, which could make 19 across **Leonov**, and that could make 15 down **Eisele**.

> 
> Take 19 across for instance. There are a lot of Russian cosmonauts with 6-letter surnames ending with V. I count at least Ivanov, Leonov, and Volkov. Any of those could be right - and that's assuming it's people not missions.
> When there's more than one valid solution and no other hints provided, it doesn't exactly make for a solvable puzzle.

Well, we know the yellow one is SEVEN, so how many fit using those letters in the middle?

> 
> Well, we know the yellow one is SEVEN, so how many fit using those letters in the middle?

The yellow one could also be TODAY. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> Well, we know the yellow one is SEVEN, so how many fit using those letters in the middle?

If we take Eisele for 15d, Leonov does nicely for 19a.

> 
> The yellow one could also be TODAY. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Because countdowns usually go from 8 to 0, skipping 7 through 1 ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
10 across is LM I think.

> 
> That's basically what happened... there's an updated puzzle: [https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CDC072SVAAA4oOt.png:large](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CDC072SVAAA4oOt.png:large)

For tomorrow, can we get a logic puzzle? I'm terrible at pop culture puzzles and I really want to play. PLEASE!

> 
> For tomorrow, can we get a logic puzzle? I'm terrible at pop culture puzzles and I really want to play. PLEASE!

I'll think about it, but I never made a logic puzzle before (and never made a crossword either, can you tell? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) )
If 1d is Tereshkova 3a can't be Curiosity.

> 
> I'll think about it, but I never made a logic puzzle before (and never made a crossword either, can you tell? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) )

LOL, well now that I think about it, I can't think of one you could tie to the countdown and some kind of space reference either.
So.... today was 7? that means.... 1.0 will be either on the 27th or 28th of april... (Reason for 28th being in there is i'm having a huge brainfart after pulling an all-nighter)

> 
> So.... today was 7? that means.... 1.0 will be either on the 27th or 28th of april... (Reason for 28th being in there is i'm having a huge brainfart after pulling an all-nighter)

27th would be "zero" in the current countdown.

ok, that i compiled and figured out myself:

3h: Carpenter, 4v: Atkov, 1v: Tereshkova, 2v: Jahn, 5h: Kanai, 7h: Armstrong, 7v: Aldrin, 10h: Lu, 11h: Hedfield, 8v: Shepard, 9v: Ride, 16v: Glenn, 19h: Leonov, 18v: Revin. not sure for 16h: Gagarin, 17v: Reiter as IDK who migth be 12v...

ALSO to mention if 12v Guidoni then there is no russian surname ending on d...

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-20T16:02:45Z" title="04/20/2015 04:02  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 20, 2015</time> by Volodyuka**

I think it's all people; started looking at missions, but couldn't get many that fit.

Here are my guesses so far:

> 
> 1D: Tereshkova
> 
> 3A: Carpenter
> 
> 3D: Cristoforetti
> 
> 4D: Atkov
> 
> 7A: Armstrong
> 
> 7D: Aldrin
> 
> 8D: Shepherd (Shepard after the fix)
> 
> 9D: Ride
> 
> 10A: Lu
> 
> 11A: Hadfield
> 
> 12D: Guidoni
> 
> 15D: Eisele
> 
> 19A: Leonov
> 
> My only problem - I can't see any 4-letter cosmonauts for 2D except Volk, which wouldn't fit with Armstrong for 7A.
14 down could be **Wetherbee**? That would make 21 across either **Belyayev** or **Nelyubov**, but either could be used in this case.

> 
> I think it's all people; started looking at missions, but couldn't get many that fit.

There are so many missions, so many probes, subprobes, rovers etc... there should be enough ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Here's mine so far. I know we were thinking Glenn for 16D, but I can't corroborate with a 16A. For 2D I didn't think any Russian in history ever had a name as short as four letters ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I even checked the dogs and didn't come up with a match.

![xLsKoxu.png](http://i.imgur.com/xLsKoxu.png)

Ã¯Â¼Â Volodyuka

Thank you for Jahn - I couldn't find him.

That makes 5A Mukai (Mukai Chiaki, first Japanese woman in space), as Kanai is only an Astronaut candidate, and has not flown yet.

Any of you thought that the countdown might be to announcing the release date, instead of the release date itself? That would be deliciously cruel ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)
Is 2d even Russian? Dawn would fit there perfectly.

I think 2D is [Jahn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sigmund_J%C3%A4hn) - a German national who was part of the USSR Interkosmos program.

And 20A must be either Wang or Yang, although there's no way to determine which Kasper was actually thinking of.

That likely makes 18D Revin.

And what if it is a mix between all of this (both pilots, rocket/ probes names, etc)

@kuzzter

12d is supposed to be from ESA - and there are no ESA astronauts with a name starting by G long enough

Which leaves only Galileo - ESA's in progress GPS satellite constellation.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-20T16:18:16Z" title="04/20/2015 04:18  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 20, 2015</time> by sgt\_flyer**

12 vertical could not be Gagarin... it should be related to ESA: Galileo

20 may be YANG
